subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Echo box contruction.
author: William Murphy
full_text:
--0-127696520-1171322271=:41663
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Great, then see you on the April 1st. Obviously I'll need the address but we'll have lots of correspondance before then. Thanks Frank, Bill

Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:          I'm on the south side, in Littleton, yeah the 1st would be the best, since 
it's a Sunday. I still have a regular work schedule.

Chris Moon is going to be presenting the box on Coast to Coast in March(1st 
?). I kinda dread it, cuz the work load, and demand may take off, along 
with any privacy, and spare time I might have had, especailly since I'm 
still not prepared to mass produce this stuff.

Frank

>From: William Murphy <vilhellm@...>
>Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Echo box contruction.
>Date: Mon, 12 Feb 2007 13:03:41 -0800 (PST)
>
>Hey Frank, are you close to Denver? As mentioned, I'll be arriving on the 
>28th of March, and will return to pick up someone at the airport on the 1st 
>of April, then I'll come off Estes Park on the 5th. Any of those days will 
>work if it works for you. The 1st of April is particularly good if you're 
>fine with that. I really look forward to meeting you.
>
> Bill Murphy
>
>Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:
> Hi All;
>
>This is how I make the "echo box". The frame is 1/4 inch poplar from Lowes,
>the foil in the heavy duty aluminum foil, and it is glued on with contact
>cement. You can see the mic and speaker mounted opposite each other on wood
>sides. The sides are 1/8" plywood expoxied into the frame. It gives a solid
>mounting panel for the mic and speaker, and can be card board, as well. I
>try to avoid plasitc, as it seems to be "contra-ghost voice" if that makes
>any sense.
>
>Frank
>
>__________________________________________________________

>Live.com page.
>http://www.live.com/?addTemplate=ValentinesDay&ocid=T001MSN30A0701
>
>
>
